metadata.Title: CVE-2021-37600 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - low.
metadata.Description:
** DISPUTED ** An integer overflow in util-linux through 2.37.1 can potentially cause a buffer overflow if an attacker were able to use system resources in a way that leads to a large number in the /proc/sysvipc/sem file. NOTE: this is unexploitable in GNU C Library environments, and possibly in all realistic environments.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-37600` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

bsdutils - 2.36.1-8ubuntu2
No subscription required

bsdextrautils - 2.36.1-8ubuntu2
eject - 2.36.1-8ubuntu2
fdisk - 2.36.1-8ubuntu2
libblkid1 - 2.36.1-8ubuntu2
libfdisk1 - 2.36.1-8ubuntu2
libmount1 - 2.36.1-8ubuntu2
libsmartcols1 - 2.36.1-8ubuntu2
libuuid1 - 2.36.1-8ubuntu2
mount - 2.36.1-8ubuntu2
rfkill - 2.36.1-8ubuntu2
util-linux - 2.36.1-8ubuntu2
util-linux-locales - 2.36.1-8ubuntu2
uuid-runtime - 2.36.1-8ubuntu2
No subscription required

notes.Note: mdeslaur> this CVE was disputed, marking as not-affected

criterions.comment: util-linux package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.36.1-8ubuntu2').
util-linux package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.36.1-8ubuntu2').
